template.p: This industry is designed for small photography studios, including freelancers and small organizations. It is built to cater to both corporate clients (team building events, professional events, product photography) and individual clients (weddings, family events, pregnancy shoots, pet shoots, etc.).
From the website, a potential client can ask for a quote or simply get in touch. They can fill some extra details about their needs:

div.p: You can add as many fields as you want to the contact form. Simply visit the page editor, and click "Add field" after selecting the form.

template.p: Leads can also come via email using. You can assign an email alias to your CRM to get a handy overview of all your customer enquiries. Once a lead has been created, you can use it as a central point from where you can reach your customer. Any reply they send will directly arrive in the opportunity's page!
After qualification through a call or meeting, a quote can be generated detailing the services required.

Clients can sign online to confirm the quote. You can use the quotation templates service packages you may sell often. You can also assign template emails, add sections to your quotes, and specific terms and conditions! Don't hesitate to customize them to your liking.
Once a quotation is confirmed, a project is created for the shooting session.

You can modify these template projects to suit your needs, e.g. by adding tasks to them. You don't want to use project management? Feel free to replace the product by their 'no-service' equivalent to avoid the creation of a project.
From the website or via the email alias, as above.
Once qualified (call/meeting), a quote is created for the shooting with details on schedule and expected service etc. Customer can sign online to confirm.
Clients get a link to book an appointment in the template emails. This link can be sent from a Sales Order or from a Task. The client can book whatever time slot they would like from there.
